channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Ongoing fly-tipping of black bag waste on pavement and road, 20th January
item.description:
Large quantities of household waste are being repeatedly dumped in black bags on the pavement on the opposite side of the road to my property on Sudrey Street, adjacent to the emergency exit door of 181–185 Southwark Bridge Road. This issue has been ongoing for approximately three months and is not a one-off incident. The waste is frequently ripped open by animals and foxes, causing rubbish to spread along the street and carriageway. The scattered waste creates hygiene concerns, attracts vermin, presents a safety risk on this narrow road, and requires regular clearing by residents. As the street is very narrow, the spread of waste creates safety and access issues for residents, including those with mobility and disability needs, with multiple wheelchair users and disability vehicles in the area. Please investigate and take appropriate enforcement action as this behaviour is persistent.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Sudrey Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Inaccessible pathway, 20th January
item.description:
On Perry Street towards Perry Street Local there is this sign that allows for on pavement parking, however with no bay markings on the floor this car and presumably many others have parked here next to a lamp post making it inaccessible to continue on the pavement. This is incredibly dangerous when walking with children or in my case with a newborn as the road is usually very busy with big lorries. Not forgetting that that is no drop curb which makes it inaccessible for wheel chair users. Maybe it's best to create bay markings for this area or block off parking for this particular spot next to the lamppost because the sign makes people think it's ok to do so.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Street, North End, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tip gas canisters, 20th January
item.description:
Lots of gas canisters dumped on old Woolwich rd pavement. Huge amount of broken glass outside the Pilates Studio on Lassell St. Been there weeks. I’ve just been litter picking the street, it was absolutely disgusting. Myself and a neighbour filled 3 bin bags of rubbish. No council cleaning has taken place for over 6 weeks. We know that Old Woolwich Rd is meant to be cleaned once a week on a Monday, that is clearly not being done. Please remove fly tipping and clean the street.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Old Woolwich Road, Greenwich
Report on FixMyStreet
